page.title: 14FARMING NEAR HORSHAM
page.content: Farming is different to the south west of Horsham at Tower Hill as the soil is{Wealden clay.}This is non-porous so it is not good for growing crops as it gets water-logged. Near Parthings on Tower Hill there is a layer of{Horsham stone.}This Horsham stone has been{quarried}in places in the past, and some craters and quarries are still visible even though many have been filled in. Because of the porous quality of this stone, many{springs of water}trapped between the clay and stone make their way out.One of these springs was used for the cattle trough in Parthings farmyard.The spring still runs but does not supply drinking water for the cows any longer; it just runs into a little ditch and into the cattleyard where it can often overflow when there is heavy rain.
